CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 10, 1960, pg. 9 reads: "White Derelicts Still Stand - While Negro homes are being razed in North Braddock's Seddon Ave. neighborhood to satisfy protests of white neighbors, numerous derelict homes owned by whites, like this one near the razed home of Mrs. James Underwood in the 500 block of Seddon Ave., are sill left standing. Recently, a white North Braddock politician's family purchased the home above and began making minor repairs.  They had no trouble getting a building permit, as did Mrs. Loretta Hawkins, a Negro, and her contractor William Jackson, just before borough officials tore down the house she owned at 513 Seddon Ave. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Single story Insulbrick house with porch and driveway with parked truck, 500 block of Seddon Avenue, North Braddock
